title: Push, Pull, Legs
description: The classic 3-day split optimized by grouping muscles based on movement patterns. 'Push' days target chest, shoulders, and triceps; 'Pull' focuses on back and biceps; and 'Legs' hones in on the lower body. Ideal for intermediate lifters seeking consistent muscle growth across the week.

workouts.title: Push
workouts.description: Chest, shoulders, and triceps are hit with heavy presses and isolated extensions to build pressing power and volume in the anterior upper body.

exercises.name: ez bar lying bent arms pullover

workouts.title: Pull
workouts.description: Focused on the posterior chain, this workout targets back width, thickness, and bicep hypertrophy using a combination of vertical and horizontal pulling movements.

exercises.name: cable one arm bent over row

workouts.title: Legs
workouts.description: This leg session blends bilateral and unilateral movements with an emphasis on the quads, glutes, hamstrings, and stabilizers.

title: Upper / Lower Body Workout
description: This two-day split maximizes muscle growth for lifters training twice per week by dividing the body into upper and lower segments. It's ideal for lifters with time constraints or who prefer higher volume per session.

workouts.title: Upper
workouts.description: Targets all major upper body muscle groups with pressing and pulling movements plus arm isolation for balanced development.

workouts.title: Lower
workouts.description: A well-rounded leg day including squats, unilateral movement, and hip hinge mechanics to grow all regions of the lower body.

title: Full Body Workout
description: A one-day full-body plan. Perfect for busy schedules, this session maximizes training stimulus with high-impact compound movements.

workouts.title: Full Body A
workouts.description: Efficiently stimulates all major muscle groups in one go using foundational lifts that recruit multiple joints and muscle chains.

workouts.title: Full Body B
workouts.description: Efficiently stimulates all major muscle groups in one go using foundational lifts that recruit multiple joints and muscle chains. (Same as A but with different exercises for a little variety)

title: BB / CT / LS / CC (not finished)
description: A four-day program structured around synergistic muscle pairings—back & biceps, chest & triceps, legs & shoulders, and core & cardio—for comprehensive coverage and recovery.

workouts.title: Back & Biceps
workouts.description: Blends horizontal and vertical pulling movements with bicep-specific curls to build pulling strength and arm size.

exercises.name: cable standing rear delt row (with rope)
ez barbell close grip preacher curl

workouts.title: Chest & Triceps
workouts.description: Chest volume is stacked with flat and upper variations, followed by direct triceps isolation for pressing power.

workouts.title: Legs & Shoulders
workouts.description: Heavy squat variations combine with shoulder presses and raises to build both foundational leg strength and overhead pressing ability.

workouts.title: Core & Cardio
workouts.description: Stabilizing core movements and conditioning-based circuits to increase muscular endurance and cardiovascular fitness.
